title: Nvu 0.2
body: <a href="http://webperso.easyconnect.fr/danielglazman/whyNvu/nvu.html">Mozilla-based Nvu 0.2</a> is a web editor that I just came across.  I haven't tried it yet, but it looks like it might have a sweet feature or two.  Most notably the ability to extract inline styles and export them to a single document.  Considering the amount of junk HTML I've had handed to me lately, this might come in useful.  Hopefully it's as easily extensible as <a href="http://www.mozilla.org/products/firefox/">FireFox</a> is.  It's originally made for the Lindows platform (ugh), but there are also <a href="http://webperso.easyconnect.fr/danielglazman/whyNvu/nvu.html">test binaries available for Windows and Linux</a>.  I'll have to try it out and see how it performs - since it's a 0.2 test release, I don't expect it to work 100%.
